did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Correspondence, schedules, brochures, memorabilia, newspaper clippings.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: Cornell Fencing memorablia and clippings collected by Kim Charlton, a member of the team. Materials cover the Title IX lawsuit brought against Cornell University by the Women's Fencing and Gymnastics teams.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Member of the Class of 1994. Member of the Cornell Fencing Team, 1990-1994; Captain, 1992-1994; Assistant Coach, 1994-1995. One of nine female athletes to bring a Title IX lawsuit against Cornell in 1993 after the Women's Fencing and Gymnastics teams were cut. The teams were reinstated in December 1993.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: Team schedules, brochures, captain?s letters, newspaper clippings, programs, and ephemera from the Cornell Varsity Fencing team from 1990-1997. Includes press releases, correspondence, and newspaper clippings about the Title IX lawsuit brought against Cornell University by members of the Women?s Fencing and Gymnastics teams.
